messages.subject: International Democratic Education Conference in July
messages.msgSnippet: From Education Revolution E Newsletter, April 28, 2003  International Democratic Education Conference UPDATE The IDEC is looking really great. You really
messages.messageBody:
From
Education Revolution E Newsletter, April 28, 2003

<snip>

International Democratic Education Conference UPDATE

The IDEC is looking really great. You really shouldnât miss it. Our
latest new presenters are Zoe Readhead from Summerhill, testing
critics Susan Ohanian, Bill Ayers, and Mike Klonsky. This is in addition
to John Gatto, Ron Miller, Pat Montgomery, and many others.
The site at Russell Sage College looks wonderful, with two gyms, a
multi-purpose space, a basic meeting hall in an old church with
stained glass windows by Tiffany, a big open central quad, many workshop
spaces, etc. Our biggest problem has been raising the funds
so that the low income schools from around the world can attend. So far
we have students and teachers from 18 countries coming.

We still have good sleeping spaces left at the conference site, Russell
Sage College, in Troy, NY. The cost is still amazingly low, as little
as $15 a day for food $15 a day for sleeping, and $10 for the conference
fees. And special group arrangements can be made. But time will
run out for those rates pretty soon, unless you at least contact us and
let us know you are coming. You can do that by replying to this e
newsletter. A deposit holds your place. The IDEC is from July 16-24. All
the info is at www.idec2003.com.

<snip>

SEND THIS TO SOMEONE ELSE
We now have over 4000 readers, all people who have contacted AERO
directly! Is there someone you know who would benefit from the
information in these dispatches? Please forward this one to them and
have them visit the AERO Web site at www.educationrevolution.org
and sign up for the free e newsletter.

Jerry Mintz
Education Revolution E-News
Alternative Education Resource Organization
